text: CLOSE ON  The Pet of the Month as she smirks coyly from t centerfold, her body twisted into an awkward position representing mad desire. Sixpack closes his privacy door then smirks back at the photo.
Oh, Darlin'...come sit on my face...

He stirs in the bed and adjusts his pillow and SCREAMS! SEA SPIDER is suddenly right there on his shoulder, dead. Sixpack sits bolt upright in his bunk and slams his head against the roof of the bunk, then stumbles out screaming He hits the floor and rams his foot into a table and scre in more pain. The whole dorm looks up amazed, Cobb takes off his sunglasses, even Jones and DeJesus temporarily "sober up" stare.
That bitch!
Sixpack storms into the Mess with the dead Sea Spider.  H points angrily at his bleeding foot.  Jones and DeJesus m up to watch.
(moving into room) Bitch!  Look what you did!
(imitating Sixpack) Sorry, darling...Just thought a little humor would loosen us all up...you know?...
Everyone laughs, but Sixpack.  He has revenge in his eyes He holds out the ugly, limp creature and advances toward Willie.
You think you're so funny? Wait till you taste this!
As he pushes the dead creature into her face BECK'S VOICE behind him makes him freeze.
That's enough!
Everybody turns to see Beck standing in the doorway.
Look at my foot, sir!  This bitch put a goddamn sea monster in my bunk!
(cold as ice) How do you know it was Williams?
(trapped) Huh?  I...uh...uh...
All right, Sixpack, you and Williams are gonna pull water duty tomorrow--
(protesting) Bullshit!  What?!  She...He...
(cutting them off) At ease!  You both have a half day...Anymore shit and its a full one.

SCREECH!  Chalk on the blackboard as Bowman writes "2" in place of yesterday's "3" over the neatly lettered words "Days Till Pickup." Jones, sitting next to Cobb, looks up from his tray of cereal and holds his head in mock misery.
Oooooh.  Damn!  Not so loud. Turn down the music.
What music?  There ain't no music.
DeJesus enters holding his head and sits on the other sid of Cobb.
Oooooh.
Cobb looks from one man to the other, realizing what they doing.
You know it's really crazy to pretend to be drunk, but it's fucking insane to pretend to have a hangover.
(to Jones and DeJesus) Your "hangovers" made you miss the Sixpack Good Morning Show. (imitating Sixpack) "No goddamn boy is going to make me go out on a down day."
(grinning) Yeah?  How'd the kid hold up?
(pleased) Pretty good.  He sent them out videotaping outcrop.

CLOSE ON  A whirling cylinder tool we see is attached to end of Willie's mechanical suit arm.  Like a drill its diamond bits cut into the rock outcrop to take a core sample.  It's a sinister hand-attachment, something Capta Hook would have loved. Above her the ROV maneuvers into position for a better vi

Beck is in the control station, staring at the video monitors--the image from the ROV.  Willie removes a slend instrument, like a bicycle pump and with a quick pump motion, CHUNK, CHUNK...activates an explosive charge.  Sh puts it into the hole she made with the drill and backs o
Charge set?
Charge set.  Backing off. (to the ROV) C'mon Rover let's get out of here.
Like a good dog, the ROV follows her to a safe position.

head_text.subj: ON MONITOR THE CAMERA HOLDS ON THE SPOT. SUDDENLY THE
GROUND SHAKES VIOLENTLY ON THE MONITOR SCREEN--A MINI
WILLIE RETURNS TO THE SITE OF THE CHARGE AND REINSERTS HE
DRILL, EASILY REMOVING A TEST SAMPLE.

text: Willie holds out the sample to the ROV so Beck can see inside.
He stares at the image on the screen.
I need more light on that, Four.
(to Beck) Roger... (to Sixpack) More light, Sixpack...
There is no answer.  Willie turns around.  Her helmet lam eerily illuminating the darkness around her.  Sixpack is nowhere to be seen. WILLIE(cont'd) Sixpack?
She turns in the other direction and suddenly blinding lights are turned on.
Boo!
Sixpack laughs.  His lights now on, he stands right behin her.
You shit....
What's going on, Four?  What's happening?
We're fine, Shack.  His lights malfunctioned for a minute.  How's this?
She again holds out her hand to the ROV.
Beck looks at the monitor and presses a red button to sta the tape, then after five seconds releases the button.
That's great.  Now let's move 35 degrees southwest.
(to Sixpack) You screw around like that again and--
What's wrong, did you miss me?
Hardly.
Don't worry, darlin, I'm...
Suddenly Sixpack's foot hits some loose rock and slides. Willie turns in his direction and sees his headlight turning, becoming smaller, then disappearing as his radio goes dead.
What's wrong?!  What happened?
ON WILLIE  She has stopped in her tracks.  All around her blackness.  Her helmet light hardly penetrates the darkne
Sixpack?!  Sixpack...
Then she looks down--a cliff right in front of her feet. The drop is thirty feet into a waving sea of tubers. BECK'S VOICE brings Willie back.
Willie?  What's going on?
He's gone.  I think he's fallen.  I'm going down after him.
Jones is bench pressing 200 pounds on a fold-down compact gym, while DeJesus huffs and puffs on an exercise bike.
That's it Jonesy...Sweat it out, man...Got to get the poison out of our blood.
Jones grits his teeth and struggles against the weight, suddenly Bowman throws open the door and sticks her head
Sixpack is lost.
Bowman, Jones and DeJesus are heading for the control roo where they are joined by Cobb.
Weren't they tied?  They're supposed to be tied.
They all enter the
Beck is at the console with Doc in his chair.
How far away is she?
Two hundred meters.
WILLIE'S VOICE silences them.
Four to Shack...nearing the bottom.  Look at this...
They all stare at the monitor.  The screen is filled with huge waving tubers.
My God, look at the size of those tubers....
Nine, ten feet high...
If he had his blinkers on--
It wouldn't make any difference in there...He could be two feet away and on fire and she'd still not see him!
ON WILLIE  She moves through the dense waving forest of giant tubers, parting them with her hands as she moves slowly.
Sixpack?
Why can't we pick up his signal?
(a joke) Maybe he got eaten?
(dryly) What would be dumb enough to eat Sixpack?
She moves aside the last of the tubers and freezes at the sight in front of her.
Four to Shack...you picking this up?
All eyes suddenly go to the monitor.  A huge dark maw fil the screen.
Affirmative...Widening picture.
The image on the screen widens and we see the opening is huge gash in the side of a sunken ship. BECK(cont'd) (to DOC) Tighten the picture on the upper righthand corner.

CLOSE ON THE MONITOR:  The picture zooms in on the corner and Willie's added light suddenly brings the letter "M" i focus. Beck presses the red record button and pans the ROV slowl across the bulkhead of the ship.  The next letter is an " Then suddenly a Cyrillic letter appears, then others.
What the?...
Russian.
I'm going inside.
What's your air reading?
Twenty minutes...
Twenty minutes!...Who had tank duty?
Who else...Sixpack.
The man is unbelievable... I say, leave him in there.
(dryly) What about his suit?  That's a million five the company's got to replace.  They'll make somebody go get it.
(to Willie) Willie, we're giving you five minutes...after that we're coming in.

Her life-support gauges move eerily around the perimeter her mask.  She moves along steadily down darkened corrido She opens a door and it drops from its corroded hinges--a cloud of sludge rises off the bottom.  The room looks emp
Sixpack?...Answer me.

She throws open another door.  It also looks empty, then WHAM! a grotesque ECHONODERM slams into her helmet.  Will bats it aside and as soon as she recovers shines her ligh into the room. WHAT SHE SEES:  The ship's infirmary.  Broken glass, stainless steel...the light does strange things, reflecti sparkling...
The infirmary...
Three minutes...
Her helmet-mounted camera pans the room one more time, th as she turns to leave it captures a strange gleam of whit in the corner--A LARGE HUMAN-LIKE SKELETON.  Willie doesn see it.
CLOSE ON DOC  He stares at the monitor screen.  Did he se something or were his eyes playing tricks?  He looks acro the console and sees the videotape is recording.
ON WILLIE  She moves to the end of the hall.  It ends wit two doors.
One minute.
Willie hesitates at the junction and PUSHES OPEN the door her left, SOMETHING HUGE BEHIND IT MOVES--IT'S SIXPACK. mechanical arms suddenly rise and in their grasp we see t ship's huge safe.
(laughing) I'm rich, honey.  Rich!
The door to the Russian ship's safe stands open.  BANG! BANG!  Jones and DeJesus hammer safety deposit boxes with chisel.  While the others watch, Sixpack pleads his case with Beck.
It's all mine if I'm on report. Otherwise you gotta take me off report before you look at any more... Ain't that right, Cobbie?
You're on your own, Sixpack, you fucked up everybody's day off...

DeJesus pries off the top from the first safety deposit b and dumps the contents on the workbench...several wallets wristwatches, a pocket watch, a wedding ring...Bowman who stands with a clipboard begins taking inventory.
Personal effects...
(considering a watch) Timex...
She picks up something else, a pack of soggy chewing gum tosses it to Cobb. WILLIE(cont'd) Here's something for you, Cobbie.
(checking a wallet) Russian money...Don't look like much.
Jones opens the next box and dumps it out onto the table...Life Savers candy, a postcard of a fat Russian wo in a bathing suit.  Bowman looks at it.
(grinning to Sixpack) Yeah, I'd say you can retire with all this loot.
Shut up.
Everyone chuckles.  More papers and a small, book-shaped object wrapped in plastic.  Jones unwraps it.  It's a vid tape.  He looks at the label.
What is it?
(reading) "Debbie Does Dallas"... (looks up and grins) Hell, it's in Russian.  I can't read it...
May I see it?
Jones hands it to Doc who looks at it. DOC (cont'd) It's a log of some sort.

Jones pries the lid off another box and dumps it out--Papers, more cheap watches. ON SIXPACK  He notices something silver, the size of a paperback book, under a stack of papers.  Discreetly he covers the object with a piece of paper and slides it off the table out of sight. Jones opens the last box, and something rolls across the table toward the edge and starts to drop when it is caugh by DeJesus.  He holds it up and we see--a clear liquor bottle.
Vodka.
What assholes, they lock booze in the safe.
Probably confiscated.  No booze on board, same as us.
Doc turns the bottle around in DeJesus' hand so he can re the label.
(eyeing the bottle) Stolichnaya.
Everyone looks at Doc.
You read Russian?
Russian, French, Italian, Spanish, Greek, German, a little Hindu, some Serbo Croat and a smattering of Swahili...standard pre-med background...
Cobb stares at him a second then:
Bullshit.
(grins) ...and a Russian grandmother...
Beck ignores them and addresses Bowman.
I want all this stuff impounded in the supply safe.
He lifts the bottle of Stolie out of DeJesus' hands. BECK(cont'd) ...except this...it goes in my safe.
A disappointed crew watches Beck leave with the bottle. stops him.
(to Beck, holding up the videotape) You mind if I take a look at this?
(leaving) Be my guest.

The gloomy corridor outside the Infirmary.  It is empty, silent.  Suddenly the door to the Infirmary opens slightl and Bowman peeks out.  Seeing the corridor is empty she slips out with a a manila folder.
Bowman hands the envelope to DeJesus, who's grinning delightedly.
You got 'em!
Sixpack and Jones are there too.  Sixpack scowls.
What good's the kid's med records anyway!
Watch and learn, amigo...
We see a thin, bearded man in his late fifties, a RUSSIAN SHIP'S CAPTAIN talking to the camera in Russian.  The tap is of poor quality and water spotted.
(translating) Another party last night.  More Vodka.  The infirmary is filled as it is.  I confiscate what I can, but I know the Government Observers have more...
Suddenly, the captain hears a noise off-screen and goes t the camera and turns it off.  The tape goes blank.

He stops the tape and presses another button on the conso WILLIE'S VIDEO of the huge hole in the hull of the ship appears on another screen. DOC(cont'd) See that gash?  The way the edges protrude inward is like from a torpedo explosion.  It couldn't have come from within. Like an accident.
He looks back at Beck who we see is sitting behind him, a has also been watching the tape.  Beck looks at Doc and shrugs.
What do you want me to say? That it all sounds mysterious?
These observers were doing something. A test...I think they sank that ship on purpose to cover up their mistakes.
What mistakes? (he shakes his head wearily) Look, I think it's no big deal but if you want to find out why this ship sank have Maritime run a check.
He gets up and goes to the door.  Doc watches him.
I did.  They have no record of the wreck. (beat) The Marshal Goloviev is now on a tour in the Baltic Sea.
Beck stops.  This is a mystery.
Fingers fiddle with the combination.  He pulls on the handle.  The safe doesn't budge.
(whisper) It's not the phone number...
We pull back to see that DeJesus is alone in Beck's darke quarters, he talks to the P.A.  Suddenly we hear BOWMAN'S VOICE over the intercom.
(on intercom) Okay, try the social security number...
DeJesus puts his fingers back, on the safe dial.
Okay, give it to me...
(reading off of Beck's forms) Two...twelve...ninety-six.
(scoffingly) You guys are so full of shit... Who's going to use their birthday...
(over intercom) BINGO!
(suddenly sitting up) Like I said, that bottle's mine!
ON Beck at the door and Doc.
I want your permission to check that vodka.
Beck looks at him.  It is obvious that he doesn't trust D with the vodka, but he's diplomatic.
This is a mining shack, not a lab, Doc.  If there's something strange with the vodka it's safe till we get back.
ON COBB  Standing watch for DeJesus.  Suddenly the door t the Control room opens and Beck walks out.  Cobb grabs a walkie-talkie.
Beck's coming.
He hears Cobb and freezes.  He looks around--the cramped quarters don't offer much in the way of hiding places.
They react similarly to the sound of Cobb on the P.A.
Beck stops outside his door and sees Cobb.
Something wrong, Cobb?
(struggling) Uh..Excuse me sir, it's the air recirculating system, sir...
What's wrong with it?
(thinking fast) ...I'd really have to show it to you.
(beat) All right...
Cobb smiles, he can't believe his luck, then Beck holds u the videotape. BECK(cont'd) ...Just let me put this in my safe...

Before Cobb can react Beck opens the door to his quarters and steps inside. BECK'S QUARTERS  WE SEE no sign of DeJesus.  Cobb follows into the room, looking carefully around for sign of DeJes In the mirror to Beck's bathroom, Cobb spots DeJesus pressing against the wall.  Cobb suddenly starts to sweat bullets.  Beck quickly unlocks the safe, opens it, and pu the videotape  right next to the bottle of Vodka. We see Cobb's reaction.  Beck turns.
Something wrong?
Cobb shakes his head weakly and starts to follow Beck out he sneaks a look back at DeJesus in the shadows who gives him a thumbs up.
Five specimen cups filled with vodka.  Bowman takes hers looks at it questioningly.  Cobb watches the door for sig of the officers.
Cute, DeJesus...Specimen cups?
Aw, loosen up, Bowman... (he looks over and notices Willie) Hey, Willie, I got one served up for you.
Willie shakes her head.
No, thanks.  I've got my blood tests in three days.
That's all you do is exercise. You got to learn to live a little.
After my astronaut training physical,
then I'll tie one on.
Forget space cadet, I'll drink hers.
Hey what happens it he goes back and finds the bottle missing?
He won't...
He holds up a plastic IV bag filled with clear liquid. DEJESUS(cont'd) I poured the vodka in here.

Cobb, Jones, DeJesus, Bowman, and Sixpack grin and clink glasses, then knock back their vodka.  Afterwards we get their reactions. JONES:  Looks concerned. BOWMAN:  Shakes her head, something's wrong. DEJESUS:  Can't get the taste off his tongue. COBB:  Seems totally satisfied. SIXPACK:  who has held the liquid in his mouth savoring i suddenly spits the vodka out.
Shit!  It's water!
Beck switched it!
Can you beat that?  The sonof- abitch doesn't trust us!
Willie grins at her co-workers and Beck's move and jogs o into the corridor.  Sixpack disgustedly tosses his shot glass away and leaves.
That little turd.  If I ever get the chance I'll fix his ass.
The others put down their glasses disappointedly except Bowman.  She watches Sixpack.

SIXPACK'S BUNK  He closes his privacy door and hesitates if listening for the others, then he removes a silver fla with Cyrillic lettering--the silver object he palmed in t Swamp--and smiles as he takes a long pull.  Suddenly WHAM The Privacy door to Sixpack's bunk is slammed open. Startled he turns startled to see--BOWMAN.
Didn't I ever tell you vodka was my favorite drink?
She holds out her glass.  Sixpack looks around the Dorm, it's empty, then grins sheepishly and pours her a shot.

ON WILLIE  She is jogging through the corridors.  Suddenl there is a GREAT GROANING NOISE.  Willie stops and looks through the steel mesh wall into the machine floor.  The dark shapes of the machines move monstrously in the dim light.  The GROANING ends and she jogs on to the Swamp. As she passes the door she notices the light and stops. stands with a clipboard by an equipment cabinet filled wi the parachute-like Container Transporters we saw outside. He sees her.
That was a loud one wasn't it?
After a month of it you'd think I'd be used to it.

She moves into the Swamp and goes to the Lift Lock, stopp under one of the ladders she leaps up and grabs a metal r above her and begins doing her chin-ups as Beck watches h lean body easily doing the exercises.
(watching her) How's astronaut training?
Why?  You going to give me hard time like the others?
No.  I'm just being friendly.
(beat) Good...It's going good.
Beck tries to concentrate on his inventory, but continues watch Willie's sexy, athletic body.
Whatever made you want to do a tour down here?
I need electrical field experience on my resume. Everything helps... (she watches him) Why are you here?
Everybody in corporate training serves a tour on the line.  Sup- posed to hone leadership skills or something.
Has it helped?
Beck shrugs.
I guess there's not a lot of adventure in the Control Room.
Beck looks up and they lock eyes.
You think I should hang around more with the crew?
Well, I always heard you don't "learn" leadership, you earn it. (beat) How did you know they'd get into the vodka?
Beck looks up from his clipboard and smiles.
I guess I figured if I was in their shoes that's what I would've done.
(smiles) Maybe you're more one of us than you think...sir.
SCREECH!  The chalk shrieks across the blackboard, making "1" over the words "Days Till Pickup." Jones looks up from his cereal at Bowman, the culprit wit the chalk.
Puuleeeeze...
DeJesus puts on his wet suit which goes under his large mechanical suit and gets ready to join the others in the mess.  He notices Sixpack's privacy door is still closed bangs on it.
Hey, Sixpack...Rise and shine amigo...
There is no answer.  Carefully he opens the door and is surprised to find it empty.
CLOSE ON Sixpack's eye.  We pull back to see it is being examined by Doc who frowns.
Let's see your tongue.
Sixpack obliges as Beck enters.
What's wrong?
Pretty good imitation of a hangover and I ought to know.
Well, it ain't!  It feels a thousand times worse.
Where?
I...I dunno.  I just feel... wrong.
Take off your shirt.

Sixpack pulls off his shirt.  Doc frowns in surprise. WHAT HE SEES:  SIXPACK'S TORSO  There are strange black areas, each of them an inch in diameter. DOC (cont'd) (concerned) How long...how long have you had these?
(surprised, scared) Shit, Doc...I didn't know I had them.
Doc peers closely at the skin where it's discolored.  It' different texture.  Beck watches as Doc touches a spot an Sixpack screams in agony.  Doc and Beck lock eyes.
CLOSE ON MARTIN on Beck's video monitor.  He is drinking cup of coffee.
...as long as you know it's not in your contract.
I know that.
Well, suit yourself, then...its your decision... (he chuckles) Ha ha...a little joke...suit yourself...
Beck interrupts impatiently.
How's the weather for pickup tomorrow?
(looking at a report, then up at Beck) Beautiful.
The crew members climb into their suits.
Bad as he is there's no way we can make our quota with- out his sad self out there. You just can't do it.
(angrily) He's tanking on us...
No...he's really sick.  I heard him last night.  The company will take that into consideration...
Honey, the company don't give a flying fuck about "whys," they just look at the numbers and the contract says if we miss our quota they only got to pay us half-pay for the entire month.
(convinced) 'Cocksucker's tanking on us...
Suddenly all eyes go to the door, Beck enters.
(to DeJesus) No, he's really sick...He won't be going out today.
The crew increases its bitching...
There goes our quota...
Thirty days, right down the toilet...

Beck ignores them and goes to the control rack which send the suits around the room and pushes number 8--his suit. DeJesus and Jones share a look.  Bowman and Willie watch carefully.  As Beck's suit stops in front of him the room quiet, they can't believe their eyes.  Awkwardly, Beck tries to get into his suit.  Cobb breaks the silence.
Excuse me, sir...
Is this a contract violation, Mr. Cobb?
No sir...I just wanted to know if you needed a hand?
Beck sees he's sincere, then looks at the others and Will She nods slightly.  Beck turns back to Cobb.
(beat) Thanks...

Doc and Sixpack.  Doc takes a blood sample, seals it and opens a cabinet under the sink where a supply of blood is stored in a refrigerated unit.  The plastic bags of blood are labeled with the various crew members' names. Sixpack watches him from the examination table.  He is shivering violently and scared.
(he's losing it) Please, Doc...I'm cold...I hurt...
We see a change in Doc's demeanor.  He is suddenly needed and it has touched something in him and we see him rising the challenge.
I'm just going to take a tiny piece of skin to look at under the microscope...Afterwards I'll give you a sedative.
Skillfully Doc takes a skin sample.  Sixpack screams.
An enlarged view of the cells in alarmingly hyperactivity We see it literally spreading before our eyes.

He leans back from the microscope.  There is awe on his f for the first time since first year medical studies--and there is fear of the unknown.  He looks over his shoulder Sixpack, his shivering has stopped, he lies still on the table.
Lights move in the blackness, but there is an order to th actions and a crispness to the voices.  People doing work that is moving sharply.  Pride in what they're doing.
Okay, number 23's full.
Let's get it out of here and bring in a new one.
Yes sir...
Hook's on 24...
Let's have her...
The Container transporters fill with compressed air and l the container as the miners guide it to the track...
Doc is at the console of his computer.  As words appear o the screen, obviously in response to his query... "...would appear to indicate a virus of unknown origin... Doc shakes his head disgustedly.
(to himself) No kidding?  "A virus of unknown origin."  Come on and tell me something I don't know... like what's going on...
More words come up.  "...no idea..." DOC(cont'd) (typing, angrily) Then take a guess, goddamnit!
He finishes typing and waits for an answer.  The cursor flashes the word "PROCESSING".  Then an answer comes up. "Genetic Alteration?"  The words send a chill down Doc's spine.
The mood is happy.  Like a high school football locker ro after a winning game.  DeJesus climbs out of his suit and slaps Beck on the shoulder.
Good work out there, Mr. Becky.
Beck, obviously pleased, looks at the others.  Jones sums the feelings of the entire group.
Thank you, sir.
Beck's grin suddenly disappears at the sight of a flashin red light over the intercom.
Beck is standing in the doorway of the Infirmary, glaring Doc, who sits with his bottle of Old Granddad.
Dead?  This morning you said he had some skin disorder.
He did.
Well, how the hell does a skin rash kill you in eight hours?!
Doc looks at Beck wearily and hands him a mask.
Here.  Put this on.  You examine him.
I'm not a doctor.
For this...you don't need to be.
Beck hesitates, then puts on the mask.

As Beck enters, masked, Sixpack's back is to him under th sheets.  Slowly he pulls back the sheet and recoils from sight.  The black splotches have nearly all grown togethe His fingers have lengthened and become more webbed.  Most dramatically the sores on the sides of his neck have beco flared and elongated.  Though not bleeding, the open vein are visible.
Doc pours some bourbon in a glass, and takes a sip.  Beck enters dazed from the sick room and their eyes meet.
The mask is because you think it might be...catching?
I don't know.  I've been back and forth with Narragansett Naval all day, consulting with the best people in maritime medicine, the best people in viruses...
(impatiently) And?
And they didn't believe the symptoms I described...
(beat) Why Sixpack?
It could be a million things, something in the air, food.... (he looks up and locks eyes with Beck) But he went on that ship and so did Williams... (beat) I want to examine the crew.
(still in shock) Yeah...right...
He starts to the door and Doc watches him.
I've reported the death to the company.
The mess is quiet.  All eyes are down.  Sixpack's absence noticeable.
"Routine," my ass!  Ain't nothin' "routine" about no physical check- up 10,000 feet down...especially when we're getting picked up the next day!
He didn't say it was a "routine check-up," he said it was a "routine
precaution
Must be bad.  Even sick Sixpack never missed a meal.
It's this fucking air system....
Ain't the food or the air system, he's just sick... Everybody gets sick every now and then.  It's all part of being human!
Bowman suddenly becomes pale.
Well, I must be human because I'm sure as hell sick.
She gets up from the table and dashes for the toilet.
Pale skin, fishbelly white with white hairs, seen closely
I guess I'm kinda...outta shape... (a pause, no answer) This skin condition...what is it? Like herpes, or measles, or what?
It's difficult to describe.
Doc is scrutinizing Cobb's flabby body closely.  They're alone in the shower room.  Stainless steel, and mirrors. stops and checks a place on Cobb more closely.
(watching, nervous) Christ, it'd be a hell of a thing if I went back to the roof with some kind of herpes thing.  My wife wouldn't understand that at all...
Doc peers closely, satisfies himself that it's nothing.
You seem all right.
(relieved) She wouldn't understand.  She'd think I was down here fucking my head off.
DARK SKIN/ PORES  Black skin, seen very close, the pores appearing like craters. We're looking at Jones' naked body...rippling muscles.
(grumbling) This whole thing's unnecessary, Doc. Only "skin problem" I got is white people... (beat, suspiciously) How come you're wearing those gloves?
Firm, lovely breasts, smooth skin...
This disease...do you know what causes it?
Doc turns Willie around and examines her firm naked buttocks.
Not yet.  You got any ideas?
(suddenly) You don't think it was from going on that ship do you?
That's a possibility.  But if it was that simple why haven't the symptoms begun on you?
Doc turns away to let her dress.
You mean I'm okay?
You're fine.
DeJesus' body is being examined...tan skin, wiry muscles seen very close.  As we move along the skin, it seems eve moment as if the next instant will reveal a dread blemish
What do you mean, "a skin problem"... your skin changes?
DeJesus, naked, with his back to us.  Doc examines him.
It blackens...becomes scaly.
(joking) You mean like a fish?
DeJesus chuckles, but something about the thought stops D
(almost to himself) Yes...like a fish...
(smiles) I was just joking, Doc.
Beck sits in his chair reading the TRANSOCEAN OFFICERS INSTRUCTIONAL MANUAL. INSERT:  The chapter he's on says:  BODY DISPOSAL AT SEA. The face of Martin stares back at us.
Well, according to Maritime law, you, as commander of the Shack have the authority to dispose of the body.  However, the company doesn't want you to do that.
What you don't understand is that my crew is in jeopardy.
But you don't have any proof at this point to assume that this disease is contagious, do you?
I'm not anxious to find out, either.
Beck, trust me.  If the company felt that you or your crew were in any danger we would authorize an immediate emergency pickup. We could be there in a few hours.
Do it.
(beat) Unfortunately.  We can't.

He picks up a sheet of computer paper. MARTIN(cont'd) There is a typhoon about 600 miles off the coast of Baja. It's not coming your way but the Company doesn't want to lose you folks or an emergency ship should it veer your way.
What're you saying?  That we're not even going to be picked up tomorrow?
It shouldn't be a long delay.
But it's a delay!  How long? A day?  Two days?!
Twelve hours, no big deal.  We should know something first thing in the morning.  Don't worry.
Willie enters the room with several sinks and a couple of toilet stalls.  She approaches one of the sinks and pulls toothbrush from the pocket of her robe.
Bo?  Doc says you're next.
Just then she hears a retching sound from one of the stal WILLIE(cont'd) Bo?...You okay?
Willie and Jones help Bowman into the Infirmary.  She is weak from nausea.  They help her onto the examination tab and look around for Doc.  Jones sees a light on in the Si Room.

Sixpack's body lies under a sheet in the Sick room.  The door opens and Jones looks in, sees Sixpack but in the di light, doesn't realize the sheet covering him, covers the body totally.  Jones smiles.
(whispers) Hey, Sixpack...Hey, my man... How you feeling?
There is no answer and Jones slowly approaches the body.
Hey, man, we made quota to- day.  No thanks to you, you dog, but we made it...Beck helped us...We just dropped Bowman off.  I hope what you've got ain't catching...

He is almost to the table and reaches out to touch Sixpac when suddenly the body stirs.  Sixpack's foot moves sligh under the sheet as if shifting in his sleep.  Jones stops JONES(cont'd) Oh, man, sorry...you go back to sleep.
Jones returns to the examination room.  Bowman is now undressed and under the blankets on the examination table
Who were you talking to?
Sixpack...
How is he?
Sleeping.  No sign of Doc, though.  I'll check the control room.  You look in the shower room...

They leave Bowman GROANING on the examination table and h back to the main corridor.  As they leave WE HOLD ON the door to the sick room behind Bowman. Bowman writhes on the examination table in pain.  Careful she climbs off the table and goes behind a partition to throw up.

At the sink in the infirmary.  She rinses her face in the sink and pulls back her hair, suddenly she stops and brin her hands in front of her face. INSERT HER HANDS.  Huge clumps of hair have come out in h hands.  And then she sees her hands themselves.  Scaly.
Oh, God...what's going on?
She turns and looks at the light on in the Sick Room.  Sl she goes to the door and enters.
Bowman approaches the body of Sixpack.
(panicked) Sixpack...what's going on?
No answer.  She pulls back the sheet and gasps.
(panicky) You have to call them back. Explain that this is an emergency.
Jones enters.
Excuse me, sir...Bowman's sick.  She's downstairs in the infirmary.
(concerned) The infirmary?...
Yes sir, ain't that where we usually go when we're sick?
We're simply concerned about her...proximity to...
(to Jones) Sixpack's dead.
Jones looks from one officer to the other then grins.
Bullshit...I was just talking to him.  I saw him move.
What?...
Beck hits the floor off the ladder and rushes to the Infirmary with Jones.  He opens the door and freezes. WHAT HE SEES:  The examination table where Jones left her empty.  The room deserted.
(pointing to examination table) I left her here.
DOC comes up behind them, then turns.  He hears to a HISS SOUND down the ring corridor.  He turns from the others a moves slowly toward the noise.
Doc enters the shower room, full of steam and the SOUND O WATER.
Bowman?
There is no answer and he moves toward the shower.
Bowman.  It's Doc.  I'm here to help you.

The water continues to run.  No answer.  Carefully, Doc opens the shower door. WHAT HE SEES:  Bowman.  Dead.  Her wrists have been cut a blood swirls down the drain. Doc sadly squats down beside her.  The death effects him greatly.  He feels helpless, then suddenly his eyes widen and he carefully reaches out and takes Bowman's limp arm, turning it supine.  There, running the length of the arm, SEE the black scales.
Jones and Beck lay Bowman's body carefully onto the examination table in the infirmary.  Through the Sick Roo door we see the sheet shrouded body of Sixpack.  Doc cove Bowman with a sheet as
The remaining crew, Doc, and Beck assembled in the Mess. Doc sits quietly, almost in a daze.
I can't tell you much about it, except that none of you show any symptoms.
And it killed Bo?
No...she killed herself.
ON WILLIE  the news hits her hard.
We're getting out of here just in time.
There's now a problem with the weather for pickup.  There's a typhoon in our sector... ...We're going to be delayed twelve hours...
Typhoon?!
Twelve hours!
At least we get time and a half.  That's in the contract.
Fuck double pay, man!  I want out of here!
Their argument is suddenly cut short by a NOISE from the corridor.  A THUMP!  The crew stops their grumbling and listens.  A moment later we hear another THUMP!  Beck loo at Jones.
(motions for Jones to come with him) Jones... (to the others) Stay here.

Beck leads the way slowly toward the Infirmary where the sound is coming from.  Outside the door they hear it once more.  THUMP! Carefully he enters the Infirmary and WE SEE the examination table is empty!  Beck goes to the Sick room a stops in the doorway.  Jones moves behind him and his eye suddenly widen. WHAT THEY SEE:  Both bodies now are in a motionless, hide conglomeration on the the table.
ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ.  It is quickly pulled shut, running the length of a heavy plastic bag, closing both bodies inside

Dressed in their rubber latex suits Cobb, Jones, DeJesus, Beck, and Willie carry the body of Sixpack and Bowman in zippered bodybag.  Now, well over three hundred pounds, t bodies strange shape and dead weight make it difficult to transport.
C'mon, Cobb...you're slacking...
(angrily) I ain't, goddamnit...It's Jones!..
Before Jones can argue, Beck cuts them off.
Shut up, all of you.
Mr. Beck, the contract states that no body can be disposed of without authorization of---
Fuck the contract, man!

The group turns into the Swamp where Doc waits for them b the Lift Lock.  Rounding the corner Cobb bangs into the s of a bulkhead and drops his corner of the "package."  Lik dominoes, Willie also looses her grip, then DeJesus.  The bodybag splashes into the grimy bilge water making it eve harder for everyone to get a handhold. BECK(cont'd) C'mon...Lift!
The group struggles to raise the bodybag and just get it their shoulder when suddenly we go tight on DeJesus's fac
Hey!...I feel something. It's moving!  He's alive!
I feel it, too...Someone's trying to get out.
Cobb drops his end intentionally and he kneels looking fo the zipper.
Cobb, what're you doing!
But he ain't dead!  He ain't dead.
Cobb!  Stop!

But Cobb grabs the zipper and starts to unzip the heavy b Beck tries to stop him when suddenly, WHAM!  a DARK APPENDAGE RIPS through the zipper and flails like a pressurized firehose.  It beats wildly for several second then lashes out at Cobb--ripping a gash on his forearm. While Cobb screams in pain, Beck yanks the appendage off Cobb's arm revealing a mouth full of needlesharp teeth an sharp tongue-like proboscis which has stabbed Cobb like a dagger.
It bit me!  It bit me!
While Beck and Willie wrestle the strong flopping appenda Doc rushes to the Lift Lock. DeJesus and Jones struggle to force the lurching bodybag into the Lift Lock.
Push Hazy!

The bodybag shudders like a huge cocoon about to lose its occupant.  Jones digs his shoulder down into the task jus as the bag suddenly RIPS in several places.  A tear RIPS OPEN next to Jones' head revealing the head of BOWMAN, he vacant eyes only inches from Jones' face.
Oh, Jesus Christ!  I ain't never gonna sleep again!

Suddenly a WHINING NOISE sounds behind them.  Beck looks back to see Cobb approaching with a battery operated underwater chain saw.  He's clearly intending to cut the Creature with the whirring blade.
No!
It bit me!
It's Sixpack!
I'm going to kill it!

DeJesus turns to block Cobb while the others continue to wrestle the bodybag into the Lift Lock.  The bag suddenly splits and a scaly arm protrudes.  It reaches out grabbin DeJesus.  Beck pulls him free and yells.
Close the Lock!  Now!
Doc hits the lever.  The elevator doesn't move! RRRRRRIIIIIPPP!  A scaly leg rips out of the body bag! BECK(cont'd) Hit it again!
Doc hits the elevator switch again, harder. NNNNNNN!  The Lift Lock door whines closed and a horrifyi SCREAM rises from the Lock.
The end of the appendage is severed in the closing door, disappearing unseen into the greasy bilge water. BECK(cont'd) Flush it!

Doc flips a switch and the SCREAM OF THE VACUUM PUMPS dro out the SCREAM in the Lift Lock, the wails of Cobb, and t splashing sounds of the severed three-foot section of gor muscle which slip silently and undetected under the workbench. A second later the elevator returns empty, silent, bloodstained. Beck turns on the video monitor of the exterior Lock.  Th exterior worklights illuminate millions of bubbles from t flush and the struggling movements of the bodybag before grows still once again and disappears beyond the range of the Shack lights...into the darkness. Beck turns and looks at his savaged crew.  Willie, Jones, DeJesus, Doc look like wet-suited butchers.  Splattered i blood, numbed by the experience, they are brought togethe by having simply survived.  Jones holds up Willie.  DeJes leans against the bulkhead.  In the far corner Cobb sobs quietly.

Clouds of steam.  Vaguely seen through the steam, Willie scrubbing herself almost desperately, as though the spattered blood of the creature had penetrated into her skin.  Finally she gives up almost in tears and rests her head against the wall of the shower stall.
Beck and Jones open the privacy door to Sixpack's bunk. After some digging which produces five month's supply of pornography, the empty flask clatters to the floor.  Beck picks it up.
I think we just found our problem.
Cobb pours himself a cup of coffee with a shaky hand.  Jo and DeJesus sit at a table and Willie laces up her shoes a run.  There is a feeling of anger among them.
Serves his ass right to get it.  Motherfucker brings that shit onboard.  I hope his fucking ass rots in the sea and is shit upon by the fish.
'Fucker could have gotten us all killed.
He knew better than that.
Willie finishes tying up her shoes and looks at them all coldly.
You guys sure weren't so holy when you were shooting that vodka...It could have been you.
She gets up and walks out into the Ring corridor.
WE ARE MOVING along the ship's corridor that Willie walke looking for Sixpack.

head_text.subj: WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL WE ARE WATCHING A VIDEO SCREEN IN

text: Doc and Beck replay the tape of Willie's search for Sixpa on the Russian ship.  On the monitor screen we see Willie POV of the infirmary.  The light dances off the broken gl as she turns, then the flash of white we saw before as th light moves out into the corridor.
Hold it!  Rewind it.
Beck rewinds it. ON SCREEN  we see the scene again.  Light dancing off the cabinets.  As the light starts to turn--
Stop it.
Beck pauses the tape.  We see nothing. Doc is confused.
Back it up slowly.
Beck does and we watch Doc's face as he stares intently a the screen.  Suddenly he sees it.
There.

ON SCREEN  We see it.  Caught in the turn of the camera, frozen on the screen is the clear gleaming skeletal remai of a man.  Only it is clear that this is no ordinary man. Fingers and appendages are lengthened and broader than normal.  But it is the large head and long sharp teeth th especially catches our attention.

as a hand suddenly moves into frame and we see the scene actually one of DeJesus' jigsaw puzzles.  He takes a piec of blue sky from the hundreds of pieces on the table and places it perfectly into position on the puzzle.  Jones watches him amazed.
You know that Innsbruck has 64 square miles of ski slopes, man?  Think about that. Sixty-four square miles.
He picks up another piece of blue sky and effortlessly fi it into place as Jones watches.  It's blowing Jones' mind
How'd you do that?
What?  That?...I've done this one before.  You hungry?  I'm hungry.
He gets up to go into the mess and Jones looks at him in amazement.
Hungry?  After what we just went through I may never eat again.

She jogs down the corridors toward the Swamp.  The Shack CREAKS and Willie looks down through the grating passing below her feet.  It is dark down there.  Her feet pound o the metal grating. LOW ANGLE  We watch Willie from below as she jogs past. WE TILT DOWN to the dark, still water of the bilge.  Sudd something stirs in the water--a ripple like a trout in a stream.

Using a computer plotting program to measure the dimensio of the skull on the videotape, Doc enters these measureme as they are read off to him by Beck.  As each of the measurements go into the computer an image of a skull beg to appear on the computer screen, followed by a name: DANAKIL MAN.
They found this?
No.  I think they isolated him in genetic engineering. Homo aquaticus...
Was there such a thing?
Danakil man?...one of our ancestors.  Named for the Danakil Alps in Ethiopia.
Not exactly a big ocean country.
It was when it counted a couple of million years ago when the seas came in and drove us into the water.  Most homo sapiens didn't make it...Danakil man...
adapted .
running.  She jogs past the machine room.  Looking in, th machines seem alive, pulsing, the beating heart of the Shack.  There is something else though.  We feel somethin in there watching her.
On Doc.
Some say that's why we're basically hairless, for less water resistance, faster swimming speeds...
But what about those scales... or that leech-like thing that bit Cobb?
Why stop with just one aspect of marine life?  Why not incorporate the best genetic components the ocean has to offer?...
(pointing to screen) Well, if they were perfecting an aquaman, then why's there a dead one onboard that Russian ship?  Why isn't he out swimming around?
Doc looks up at the image on the screen.  The huge skull stares back hauntingly.
(beat) He obviously lacked something in his environment.
ON COBB  He sits on his bunk and peers under his bandage. He turns on an overhead reading light and looks again. Suddenly a voice startles him.
Turned black yet?
At first startled, Cobb recovers and answers sharply.
That ain't funny.
Relax, Cobb.  If it was going to turn, it would have done its trick by now.
That's easy for you to say. You ain't the one that got bit.
Jones starts to leave when he suddenly notices something Cobb's bunk.  He picks it up and we see a photo of Cobb's family.
Don't tell me you're getting soft on us, Cobbie?  You're the fellow who always said--
Cobb snatches the photo back from Jones and glares at him with the same old, hard "Cobb look."
Nothing's changed, goddamnit!
Jones leaves, and Cobb waits till he is gone then looks b at his photo.  His look changes, softening.  Absently he scratches his bandage.
Willie enters and checks her running time on her watch. bends over to catch her breath then straightens suddenly.
WE are watching her from above.  For a moment she is quie as if listening for a noise somewhere in the Swamp.  She looks around slowly and her eyes come to rest on the Workbench.

DeJesus looking for food.  In the gloom of fluorescent lighting he opens and closes various cabinets looking for snack. He notices that the floor's wet near the sink.  He frowns and hears a SMALL NOISE, like something shifting slightly He moves to investigate, crouching low, peeking into the shadows under the sink, into a litter of cleanser bottles pails, rags...All he can see are shadows.  He looks more closely, actually sticking his head under the sink when

head_text.subj: JUMPS, BUMPING HIS HEAD ON THE SINK AS HE WHIRLS TO SEE.

text: JONES, looming over his shoulder, looking down at him.
Man, everybody is jumpy... What are you doing?
Not fully recovered from the start, DeJesus rubs his brui head.
Getting some food.
Under there?
DeJesus gets to his feet, points at the water under the sink.
Look.  Water.
Probably the plumbing.  You gonna make me finish that puzzle by myself, or what?
DeJesus continues to scrutinize the water then looks back Jones.
No, I'll be right there.
He looks down at his sandwich as Jones starts out of the galley.  Something is missing.
(to himself) Mustard.  Need mustard...
He opens the refrigerator and finds the mustard jar empty
(muttering to himself) Sixpack...
He throws the jar in the trash then opens the cabinet nex to the refrigerator for a new jar, and reaches inside.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY, LIKE A SNAKE, A TWO FOOT CHUNK OF MUSCLE ATTACH
THE TWISTING, WRITHING THING OFF. PULLING AT IT HE REVEA
PART OF SIXPACK'S FACE--ONE EYE AND PART OF HIS

text: DeJesus falls against the side cabinets screaming and causing an avalanche of pots and pans.
(in pain) Ahhh!
Jones is now putting a piece of the puzzle into place whe he hears THE CLATTER OF POTS AND PANS.
Hey, Hazy...what're you doing now...cooking?
There is no answer and Jones looks up. JONES(cont'd) (concerned) Hazy?...
He goes to the door and looks in.  His eyes widen at the sight of DeJesus staggering toward him with the squeezing hunk of muscle. JONES(cont'd) Holy shit!
Help me, Jonesy.  Oh, God, help me!  It's getting inside me, I can feel it!
He keeps coming at Jones who backs away slowly from his friend.
Hazy, please...I'm going to get you some help, man...just don't touch me...
Jones finds himself backing away until he is by the door the Galley.  He closes it, rushing through into the Mess the Ring corridor where he runs into Cobb.
What's going on?
It's Hazy...It's got him! Stay here and don't let him out.  I'm going to get the Doc.
Jones runs out and leaves Cobb by the door.  Cobb watches him go.  As the noise in the Mess intensifies, we hear banging on the door, then DeJesus' anguished cries.
Help me!  Help me!
Cobb backs slowly down the corridor toward the dorm.
Jones meets Beck and Doc leaving the control room.
It's got Hazy!
What has?
One of those chunks of Sixpack!  Like a big leech, with those teeth!...
We've got to get him to the infirmary.
What are you going to do to him?
I'm going to try to remove it.
I've got Cobbie downstairs watching the door.
Deserted.  There is no sign of Cobb and the door to the m stands open.  The mess is empty.  Beck is the first one d the ladder followed by Jones.
Cobb?  Hazy?  Oh, shit...He's gone...
Cobb returns with a mining tool.
You let him get away!
I ain't doing nothing for that thing without something to defend myself.
That
thing happens to be my friend.
Shut up, both of you!  We've got to find it.
Beck suddenly looks around noticing something. BECK(cont'd) Where's Willie?
Oh, God, she's out there...
Jones...come with me.  Cobb, you and Doc check the rooms.
Jones and Beck move down the spooky corridor toward the Swamp.  Overhead, water moves through the desalinization conduit.  Jones eyes it warily.

They enter the quiet Swamp.  The suits hang silently like sleeping monsters.  Beck steps into the equipment room. Jones walks along the suits which hang in front of him. Their empty masks stare at him hauntingly.  He reaches th end and stands in front of the ladder where we earlier sa Willie doing chin-ups.  He looks down and sees her headba floating in the bilgewater.
Willie...
Suddenly Willie lowers herself from the bar behind him.
Yeah?
The sudden sight of her nearly gives Jones heart failure, stumbles backwards into the ankle deep water and Willie drops from the bar laughing.
(grinning) What on earth's the matter with you?
I ought to smack your face!
Willie picks up the strain in Jones' voice, her smile fad
What's wrong?
DeJesus...It's got him.

Jones, Willie and Beck move quickly.  Beck pulls a portab laser drill which fits into the arm of the mechanical sui and attaches a portable power unit to the back.  Turning on it becomes a sinister close-range weapon. Willie opens an equipment cabinet and reveals deflated container transporters.  Beck notices and then looks up a Jones who opens a locked cabinet and takes out the bicycl pump/earthquake device we saw Willie use earlier.
I thought they were your friends?
Were, Doss
were . Beck reaches out and takes the powerful weapon away from him.
You fire that in here and you'll bring the whole place down.
Jones thinks about it for a moment, then reaches for one the Acetylene tanks.  He lights the end of it and a long blue tongue of flame whips out the door into the Swamp. Jones grins.

Doc and Cobb move into the Infirmary.  Doc goes into his office.  He takes three scalpels out of an equipment draw and then looks up, through the levolor blinds into the infirmary.  What he sees upsets him.
Jones working the intercom.
(to intercom) Jones to Doc.  Doc?...Cobb?
He looks back to Beck, concerned. JONES(cont'd) (to Beck) Think it got 'em?
No, it's not going through. The intercom's busted.  I thought DeJesus fixed that?
(beat, realizing) He did.

Doc leaves his office and slowly goes into the Infirmary the storage counter across the room--where the blood is stored.  WE SEE what disturbed him...the door to the refrigeration unit is ajar.  Doc opens the door to the cabinet.  The plastic bags are now empty.  Each one has b drained.

Cobb moves out of the Infirmary, carefully down the eerie corridor, his mining tool in front of him for security. There is a sinister feel to the place.  Each step only reveals a little bit of space ahead of him.  Suddenly he stops.  In front of him across the hall a cabinet which says:  ONBOARD COMMUNICATIONS, is torn open.  It is where DeJesus fixed the intercom the day before.

The door is shattered.  Carefully, Cobb opens the door an WE SEE the guts of the wiring have been torn out--the ent system has been disabled. Cobb carefully examines the damage WHEN SUDDENLY A SCALY HAND-LIKE APPENDAGE slams into the cabinet door trapping COBB and sending his weapon to the floor.  Cobb turns directly into THE LEECH-LIKE MOUTH!  It's sharp teeth shine in the ligh poised to strike. Cobb's eyes closed, screams like a maniac, waiting for th tentacle to attack.  Then suddenly an UNGODLY SCREAM echo in the corridor. COBB opens his eyes to see the tentacle gone.  Doc is holding the smoking mining drill, his eyes glazed, as if has seen the devil itself.
What happened?
(absently) It...almost got you.
What was it?
Doc shakes his head dumbly.  He is in total shock.
The remaining group is assembled around the table.  Jones watches the door with one of the homemade flamethrowers. listens.
(excitedly) I saw it!  It's big!
Big?
Bigger than DeJesus?  How?
It's had a meal.
He holds out the empty blood bags.  A change has come ove Doc since Bowman's death.  The experience has slightly deadened him.
It needs blood?
Fucking great...You telling me we got a fucking dracula in here with us?
It would explain the suction- like appendages.
Like a leech.
That's why there's a dead one on the ship.  It ran out of blood.
What dead one on the ship?
He looks from Doc to Beck. JONES(cont'd) (sharply) Someone want to let the rank and file in on your little secret?
Doc looks at Beck, then Jones.
The monster appears to be a genetic aberration...
No fuckin' lie...

...It has many traits of deep sea marine life...regeneration, scales, gills, even a period of dormancy... (more to Beck) but the fact that it remembered where the plasma was stored, or where the communication wiring was, may imply that it has some other quality...
(panicky) What?...What?
Beck locks eyes with Doc.
(to Doc) That it acquires intelligence from its victims?
Intelligence may not be the right word...
Fuck semantics, Doc! You saying its like part DeJesus, part Sixpack, part Bowman?!
(tiredly) I don't know.  I'm guessing.
(losing it) I say we should go get in the escape bubbles and get the hell out of here!
And hit the surface in the middle of a typhoon?...No, thank you. I'll take my chance down here.
Willie looks at Beck.
What can we do?
Our only chance is to lure it to the Swamp and flush it like we did the other.
And how're we going to do that?
Beck checks his flamethrower and looks at Jones.
ON BECK  He flexes his arm as a needle is taken from it. SEE a half-pint of blood in a bag, held by Doc.  He secur it and hands it back to Beck.
Be careful with it.
Don't worry, I don't want to give up any more.
He looks over at Jones who watches the door.  Jones looks back and nods.  The coast is clear.
The door to the Mess opens and Beck slips into the shadow of the hall.  A second later Jones follows.  In the dim light they begin moving toward the Lower "B" corridor to Swamp.
Cobb, Doc and Willie alone in the Mess.  Cobb scratches h bandage.  Doc notices.
Still bothering you?
Itches like hell.
Take it off and let me have a look.
Cobb pulls back the bandage and looks at the gash. INSERT COBB'S WOUND  Pink and healing.
Looks good to me.  I'll re-bandage it, though.
He looks at Willie. DOC(cont'd) Willie, would you clean it for me.  I'm going to the infirmary for supplies.
He turns and Willie stops him with a firm grip.
You can't go out there alone.
I'm the Doctor.  I have to do what's best for this crew. (he pulls away) I need my bag.
The door opens and carefully Doc steps out into the corridor.  He looks toward the Infirmary then starts up t ladder to the Upper Level instead.

head_text.subj: DROPS OF BLOOD INTO A SMALL POOL

text: a grisly sight. WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL the drops coming from the plasma b of Beck's blood.  Beck stops the drip and moves on into t darkness of the corridor.
Doc moves behind the computer keyboard in the dim light o the Control room.  His face lit by the computer monitor. types furiously.
"Emergency Escape Bubbles...ready for activation..." DOC pauses looking at the message, then moves his hand to the SEND command and presses it.
Willie prepares a clean bandage as Doc examines the cut. smiles at Cobb like a friendly country doctor.  The tired now gone from his eyes.  He seems revitalized.
There, good as new.  Just keep your paws off of it. (to Willie) Do you have the new bandage ready?

She nods.  Doc turns back to the sink and Cobb holds out arm to let Willie put the new bandage on.  As Cobb's arm comes up we suddenly notice a slight movement under his shirt.  Willie stops just before applying the bandage.  T movement intensifies--like snakes moving wildly beneath t cloth.  Cobb whitens...breaks out in a sweat.  Willie bac off.
Doc?...Doc!

She steps back and Doc moves into her place as suddenly a leech-mouthed tentacle erupts from Cobb's waist.  It's ra sharp proboscis punctures Doc's chest right at the heart the leach mouth with it's hundreds of teeth attaches with vacuum-like suction.
No!
But it is too late.  Willie falls back screaming as Cobb' gash RRRRRRRIPS OPEN!  THE FLESH OPENING GROTESQUELY FROM

head_text.subj: THE INSIDE AND INVERTS SCALY--SPREADING OVER COBB'S BODY

text: A huge shadow falls over the pool left by Beck.  A scaly tentacle suddenly whips across the floor.  The DEJESUS

head_text.subj: AN EYE OPENS AND LOOKS UP.

text: WHAT IT SEES  The outline of Beck lying "hurt" fifty feet away. It starts down the corridor toward it's prey--Beck.
A little behind him with the homemade flamethrower, Jones waits in the shadows.  Suddenly Beck hears something.
(whispers) I hear something. Don't fire until we're both in the Swamp.
Jones moves a little farther back. BECK(cont'd) Don't let him see you.
Don't worry...
As the Creature approaches WE SEE Beck stand up like a wounded animal.  He begins dragging his "injured" leg beh him as he retreats toward the Swamp.  THE FOOTSTEPS MOVE
ON WILLIE  She bursts out the door to the MESS and heads toward Corridor "B."
Beck moves through the door to the Swamp and positions himself by the door.  He looks back and WE SEE Jones for first time, flamethrower poised, ready to fire.
C'mon baby c'mon...

head_text.subj: ON THE SHADOW OF THE CREATURE

text: It moves steadily toward the door, moving right to the doorway.  Carefully it moves a dark, horrible hand-like appendage inside the doorframe.
poised to kill when suddenly both men hear the same thing
Beck?  Jones!?
She turns the corner and freezes.  There, less than ten f away is the Creature.  A tentacle whips excitedly like a tail!
Oh God...
AS THE CREATURE starts to turn for Willie, Beck suddenly closes the vault-like door to the swamp on Creature's han trapping it vise-like in the door.
Run Willie!  Run!
The Creature throws back its head and SCREAMS in pain as heavy door severs its appendage.
As the writhing hand-like appendage squirms in front of t Jones blasts it with his flamethrower until the hand curl like a piece of bacon and it ceases to move.
Well done.  Just like momma makes 'em.
Beck opens the door--the corridor is empty.  Willie and t creature are gone.
She heads back toward the Ring corridor around the inner path toward Corridor "A".  In a full run now, every panel and instrument looks even more sinister--where is Cobb/Do

head_text.subj: ON THE DEJESUS CREATURE'S SEVERED APPENDAGE

text: As the Creature moves after Willie we see its bloody stum suddenly sprout a new appendage!  Like a starfish it grow another leech like tentacle to replace the one it lost.
She turns down Corridor "A".  A NOISE overhead in the wat conduit causes her to look up WHEN SUDDENLY A BLACK ARM

head_text.subj: REACHES OUT FROM THE SHADOWS, AND PULLS HER INTO THE DARK

text: DOORWAY TO THE MACHINE FLOOR----IT IS JONES!  He pulls he between him and Beck in the shadows.
(whispered) Where's Cobb and Doc?
(recovering) Cobb's cut...It was in him! It got Doc...
Oh man, that's just great...
C'mon.
Beck is followed inside by Jones and Willie.  It is empty
Lock the door.

Jones rolls the large vault-like door closed and locks th Beck goes to the console and checks the instruments. Suddenly he sees something that causes him to freeze in h tracks.  A red light blinks ominously on the console.
Shit!  He sent them all.
The escape bubbles?
She and Jones stop in front of Doc's console.
(gravely) Look at this.
Beck looks at Doc's computer screen. ON SCREEN WE SEE DOC'S MESSAGE:  "...hope that our sacrif will mean that the human race will never know this awful mutation..."
What is it?
The good doctor signed our death warrant.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY THERE IS A TREMENDOUS BANGING ON THE DOOR
HUNDRED SLEDGEHAMMERS POUNDING THE HEAVY STEEL DOOR TRYIN

text: TO BREAK IT DOWN.  Jones readies his weapon but just as suddenly, the BANGING STOPS.  Beck, Willie and Jones all nervously exchange looks.
Well, at least we're safe inside here.
For how long?
Beck slides behind the Console and quickly types in a message.  WE SEE IT ON THE SCREEN.  "SHACK SIX REPORTING.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY MARTIN'S FACE APPEARS ON THE VIDEO SCREEN.

text: Thank goodness, you're still alive!
(yells nervously at the screen) Hey, man, you better get your ass out here right now and get us.  You hear me, motherfucker?
Right now
Martin smiles calmly back at the three of them.
Please relax, Mr. Jones.  Every- thing is under control.  Naturally, when we received Dr. Warren's message we were concerned but would never have deserted you.
Jones lets out a breath.  Willie stares straight at the screen.
When
are you coming for us?
(smiles nervously) Well, that's the bad news. The typhoon did turn your way. (he looks at weather printout) Right now it is on a course--
Just answer the question, man! When are you coming?!
(beat) Hopefully in the next 48 hours.
Forty-eight hours!
I realize you must have gone through hell--
Gone?  Man, we're still here!
(firmly) I can't change the weather. Try to get some rest.  I'll keep you posted.
He turns off his screen and the picture in front of Beck, Jones and Willie goes blank.
He's right.  Why don't you get some rest.  I'll stand the first watch.

Jones sits near the vent sound asleep, his weapon across his stomach.  Near him Willie lies still, eyes open.  She watches Beck across the room, standing at the window. He stares outside into the darkness for a moment, then as if a thought suddenly occurs to him he looks at the blank computer screen.
"Request weather summaries January 14-21."  The cursor blinks back ominously then races across the screen.  "FIL
(to himself) Martin, you asshole...
Suddenly he hears a voice behind him.
They know, don't they?
(quietly) Yeah...I think they're just deciding what to do with us.
Maybe they already have.
She moves into Doc's seat in front of the console and cal up the stock market program that Bowman was monitoring earlier. ON SCREEN  WE SEE:  Stock prices. Willie types in a series of commands.
What are you doing?
Seeing how my stock's doing...

ON SCREEN:  The words TransOcean Corp.  The capsulized re comes up on screen:  "TransOcean Corp. took a bath on wor markets today when news of a tragic mining accident was revealed to investors.  The Board of Directors...."
(impatiently) Where?....

She scrolls forward in the report and suddenly freezes th words. THE SCREEN:  "...accident took place in Shack Six, Southe Sector of Pacific Zone 10...Seven dead.  All bodies missing."  Their names follow. ON WILLIE  as her name comes up she shivers.
I can't believe they'd just leave us.
A voice behind them causes them to turn.
Welcome to the union, boss. We're all expendable.
He is now awake.  He sits up against the air vent.  Sudde Beck listens, the room is deathly silent.  He looks over the air vent.  Jones is listening also.
What is it?
The air's stopped.
WHOOP!  WHOOP!  Suddenly a KLAXON HORN sounds hystericall A blue light on the console blinks on and off.  It says "AIR."  Beck turns to the instruments.
We're on backup air.
How much time does that give us?
Less than an hour.  It's ruptured an air duct.
Can't we fix it?
There're twenty miles of pipe in the bilge, they could have tapped-in anywhere.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY WE HEAR A SOUND WE HAVEN'T HEARD IN A LONG TIME.

text: The RATTLE THAT JONES AND COBB FIXED.  Jones and Beck hom in on the tell-tale noise.
(almost to himself) Cobb...Job security...
He locks eyes with Beck.
They're drawing us out.
He leaves his seat and Jones checks his weapon as Willie watches.
You can't go out there, that's what they want.
Beck checks his make-shift flamethrower.
We don't have much choice... without air, the internal pressure will fall and--
Crunch...Implosion.
Willie watches them a moment then picks up one of the min tools, the laser-drill, she powers-it up to check it.  He action stops both men and she catches their looks.
You don't think I'm sitting in here, do you?
Carefully the three move into the Lower Ring Corridor.  A they move we suddenly hear a new sound, DEEP, LIKE DISTAN THUNDER.  The sides of the shack tremble slightly.
(low) The shack...
She's wondering what's happening.  We're losing air faster than I thought.
(to Jones) Which way?
Jones moves to the lead and turns down Corridor "A."

The SOUND of the power-wrench removing the bolts from the flooring.  The cover is removed and Beck and Jones peer d into the darkness.  Willie stands guard with the flame- thrower. ON JONES  He peers into the darkness below.  He wasn't a fan of the bilge even before the Creature, now he's scare shitless.
I'll go first.
Before Jones can protest Beck drops the ladder and climbs down into the dark bilge.  Jones waits till he's at the bottom, then starts down behind him.  Willie looks back.
Don't spend all day down there.
Don't fuckin' worry, I ain't.

From somewhere in the darkness we hear the HISSING SOUND ESCAPING OXYGEN and the FAMILIAR RATTLE OF THE AIR SYSTEM As soon as Jones reaches the bottom rung Beck shines a li into the eerie underground area. Pipes run overhead and on the walls.  A broken electrical conduit sparks over their heads.  The floor is ankle deep greasy water.  They start toward the noise.

Her back is to the solid wall(outside wall).  Her eyes mo from one end of the corridor to the other, not lingering long enough to distract her.  Sweat runs down her face an we hear another tremor in the Shack.
(to herself, calming herself) Okay, Williams...let's hear a tune. (beat, quietly at first) "Off we go...into the wild blue yonder..."
ANOTHER RUMBLE FROM THE SHACK causes her to pause.  She catches her breath and starts again. WILLIE(cont'd) "...flying high into the sky..."
She suddenly looks into the Main machine area (behind the wire mesh of the other wall).  Was it something moving?

ON BECK  He moves around a corner we recognize from befor with Jones' and Cobb's repair.  Beck floods the area with light and the break in the line is visible.  The pipe has been torn from the wall, it is totally unreparable.  What worse, electrical wires hang down, showering sparks into water.
Jesus Christ...
Can you fix it?
No way...
Think!  Can we stop it?! Block it up?!  Shut down the line somewhere?!  Think!
I am thinking, man!  You think I want to die!  I am thinking!  I--

Suddenly his eyes widen.  Beck sees this and turns.  In h light WE SEE THE GLINT OF LONG TEETH AND THE HUGE BLACK FRAME OF THE COBB/DOC CREATURE!  It's leech-like appendag whipping in front of it like an excited cat's tail.  Befo it can strike, Jones pushes Beck out of the way and fires blast of flame from his flamethrower.  The CREATURE SCREA and disappears. As Beck falls his light lands in the bilge water and goes out sending the bilge into greater darkness.
I hit it.  But I can't see it!  Can you see it?!
(standing) No.
Jones looks back at the ruptured pipe and suddenly has a thought.
The Swamp.  There's an over- ride switch in the Swamp.

They start for the ladder when WWWWHHHHHHHHIP! out of the darkness the appendage wraps like a bullwhip around Jones arm.  The deadly proboscis, which stabbed Cobb, is poised like a dagger about to be plunged into the black man's thigh.
(screams) Ahhh!
Instinctively Beck whips out the mining saw and severs th tentacle.  The unseen Creature's SCREAM echoes through th Bilge.  Beck grabs Jones by the arm and pulls him toward ladder.
Hurry...Get out!

Quickly they slosh toward the ladder and hole in the floo fifteen feet away, moving closer...ten...eight....then suddenly ANOTHER APPENDAGE thrusts between the rungs of t ladder at them.  Beck ducks and leaps to the side.  He is less than six feet from the Creature.  In the dim light W SEE it wickedly bare its teeth. Beck's eyes go to the walls from one side to the other an spot the exposed power cable.  The Creature steps forward directly under the hole in the floor.  It is about to lun when a voice from above distracts it.
Hey, you?
The Creature looks up and sees:

head_text.subj: ON WILLIE STANDING OVER THE OPENING, HER FLAMETHROWER
POINTED STRAIGHT DOWN. SHE FIRES, SENDING A SEARING BLUE

text: BECK watches the flame roar down on the monster and it gi him the moment of distraction he needs.  He leaps out of bilge water and onto a pipe on the wall then rips the bro power cable from the wall.
Jones!  Get your feet out of the water!
Jones jumps up and grabs a pipe running overhead as Beck thrusts the sparking cable into the water at the Creature feet.

head_text.subj: IN A BLINDING FLASH OF ELECTRICITY

text: The current surges through the Cobb/Doc Creature sending instantly rigid.  A second later it crashes forward into water. Moving hand over hand toward the ladder Jones quickly cli out, followed by Beck.

head_text.subj: THE SHACK CONTINUES TO SHAKE, EACH JOLT STRONGER THAN THE

text: LAST.  As they emerge Willie helps them.
C'mon, the Swamp!

They start for the Swamp down Corridor "A" when an enormo shudder goes through the Shack, causing the lights to bli and the floor to open beneath Beck.  The jolt knocks him back into the bilge.  Only grabbing onto the pipes just above the water stops him from falling back in. JONES stops and looks back over the missing grating.
Beck!
Jones moves instinctively back for him, but another jolt only widens the gap.  Beck yells to be heard over the din the collapsing Shack.
Go on!
No!
That's an order!
Fuck your orders!

He leaps across the gap onto a remaining grating and thru his hand down into the darkness.  Beck lets go of one han then the other, to grab Jones' extended arm.  In one Herculean effort Jones pulls him out of the bilge.  Toget they leap across the chasm as the Desalinization Conduit collapses over their heads and water floods into Corridor behind them.  They have to go around the other way!
KLAXON HORNS SOUND and a RECORDED FEMALE VOICE warns:  "F minutes until implosion..."

head_text.subj: THE LIGHTS FLICKER AND FAIL, CAUSING THE EMERGENCY LIGHTI
TO GO ON, AND CASTING AN EERIE STROBE EFFECT ON THE ESCAP
FALLING CEILING BEAMS CRASH DOWN IN FRONT AND BEHIND...
SEAMS BEND UNDER THE STRAIN, RIVETS POP...
STRAINING MACHINES SEND SCALDING GEYSERS OF STEAM INTO TH
CORRIDORS...AND SUDDENLY THE FLOOR GIVES WAY BENEATH WILL

text: She leaps up and grabs an overhanging pipe and swings to firm ground.

head_text.subj: JONES LEADS THE WAY TOWARD THE SWAMP, WITH WILLIE BEHIND
HIM, AND BECK COVERING THE REAR.

text: THEY reach the end of the corridor and Willie and Jones t into the Swamp Annex.  Willie hits the door opener.  RRRR IT DOESN'T BUDGE.  The pressure has bent the door frame.
It's jammed!
Immediately Beck backtracks to the corridor and pulls a h held spreader--like a "Jaws of Life"--from the wall.  He turns back to the Swamp when a BLACK SCALY ARM SUDDENLY

head_text.subj: BURSTS THROUGH THE WIRE MESH OF THE MACHINE FLOOR AND PUL

text: His head held in place by the powerful arm, Beck looks almost directly into the dark eyes of the Creature.  Its gill-like slits flare.  Its mouth opens and we see a flas of its razor sharp teeth. Before Beck can move the leech-like appendage ruptures th steel mesh and its razor-sharp proboscis plunges like a knife for Beck's face.  At the last instant Beck move his head and the proboscis slams into the steel mesh.  The me loosens the creature's grip and Beck manages to reach a mining drill from the tools on the wall.  As the appendag starts to strike again Beck buries the whining tool into Creature's tentacle and breaks free. Scooping up the spreader Beck rushes to the Swamp door wh Jones and Willie are trying vainly to hand crank the door open.
Where the hell've you been?
I got hung up!  Try this!

Willie stands back and Beck thrusts the Spreader into the tiny crack in the door the hand crank had made.  With Jon help the two men force open the door and all three rush inside the SWAMP.  Beck closes the door behind them. THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE INTONES:  "Five minutes to implosion."  And we feel it happening:

head_text.subj: THE BILGE WATER ON THE FLOOR OF THE SWAMP RIPPLES WITH TH
THE HUGE METAL SUITS ROCK LIKE CLOTHES ON A CLOTHES LINE.
ONE FALLS AND CRASHES INTO THE WATER

text: JONES throws open the control panel and grabs the red handled emergency air switch, but he can only move it hal way!  It is jammed by the pressure.
It won't go!
Willie grabs it with him, but even together it is not enough.  THE HANDLE BREAKS OFF IN THEIR HANDS!

head_text.subj: STEAM JETS WHIP DOWN ON THEM FROM ABOVE
THE WATER AT THEIR FEET NOW BOILS FROM VIBRATION

text: THE FEMALE VOICE INTONES:  "Four minutes..."

head_text.subj: BECK TURNS AND SEES THE SUITS IN THE LOCK

text: He grabs Willie and pushes her toward the Lock where her suit hangs.
The suits!  Get in them!
Willie moves quickly but Jones doesn't.
The suits!  Are you crazy! How're we going to get to the surface?
Beck yanks open the equipment locker revealing TANKS OF COMPRESSED AIR AND DEFLATED CONTAINER TRANSPORTERS.
Like this.
He looks up at Jones who grins with renewed hope and they begin pulling the equipment out. BECK(cont'd) Get them in the Lock!

Jones and Beck drag the tanks and the parachute-like Container transporters to the lock. ON WILLIE  She climbs into her suit and activates her generator.  Instantly her Vital Signs spring to life arou the perimeter of her helmet. THE FEMALE VOICE TREMBLES FROM THE VIBRATIONS..."Three minutes...to...implosion..." Beck and Jones throw the last of the supplies onto the elevator and Beck holds out the SEISMIC TOOL Jones tried arm himself with earlier.  He takes the tool from Beck an sticks it in the vest of his wet suit. Then suddenly he sees that there are only two suits in th Lock.  Beck will have to wait on his to move along the tr to the Lock.
Your suit, Becky!
Just get in yours!

Jones climbs onto the Lock platform and slides into his suit. Beck hits the Suit track button and his suit begins movin along the track toward the Lock.  A suit turns the corner from the storage room followed by one labeled BECK. Beck looks at the walls, they're shaking harder.  He move along the suit rack when suddenly THE CREATURE BURSTS FRO

head_text.subj: BEHIND THE SUITS SHATTERING THEM LIKE AN EXPLOSION
TENTACLE HURLS TOWARD BECK LIKE A SPEAR.

text: BECK ducks just in time, grabbing a fire ax and chopping the appendage.  Another tentacle jabs for Beck.
(screams) Look out!
But it is too late.  It knocks the ax from Beck's hand an sends him to the floor.  Beck looks up at the Lock in tim see Jones seal himself into his suit.
I'm in.
(to the others) Go!
No!
Beck looks at the others one last time.
Go, now!  That's an order!

Jones hits the elevator button and the Lock closes as the elevator sends them down without Beck. BECK stands and arms himself with a mining drill, which h swings at the Creature driving it back.  As Beck gets the upper hand, the Creature turns its hideous face and Beck freezes.  There attached to the back of the Creature's he is the grotesque face of DeJesus! DeJesus' eyes suddenly blink.  He's still alive!  His lip tremble in agony.
Kill me...Kill me!

Beck, momentarily stopped by the face, lunges forward wit the drill and embeds it in the side of the Creature. As the Creature falls back hurt, Beck looks up at the loc elevator as it returns--IT IS EMPTY--The others have made out!  His suit continues down the track and stops in the Lock.  He still has to make it, if he can just get there! THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE SOUNDS:  "One minute to implosion..." Beck races to the Lock and starts to climb into the suit. His arms slide into place, his legs drop into the heavy metal shell and as he seals up the back he activates the generator. BECK'S POV.  His vital signs light up around the perimete of his helmet, but he sees something else--the Creature charges toward the Lock--its arm reaches out to yank Beck out of the elevator!  Instinctively, Beck swings his motorized leg into the Creature's snarling mouth, knockin it backwards and stunning it long enough for Beck to hit elevator button.  BUT IT DOESN'T WORK!
No!
He hits again, still nothing! THE RECORDED FEMALE VOICE..."Nineteen, eighteen..."  Her voice begins to quiver.

head_text.subj: BECK POUNDS ON THE BUTTON AND LOOKS UP JUST AS THE CREATU
DIVES FOR HIM, ITS HUGE SCALY HAND GRABBING HIM AROUND

text: CLOSE ON THE ELVATOR BUTTON  Beck pounds it one last time and NNNNNNNNNNNN!

head_text.subj: OUTSIDE SECONDS BEFORE THE ENTIRE STRUCTURE COLLAPSES WIT
IMPLOSION AND SUDDENLY EXPLODES IN A HUGE SHUDDER OF ENER

text: WHOOSH!  A parachute-like Container Transporter zoom towa the surface.  A heavy-suited crew member flashes past us. Its helmet light pierces the darkness, then disappears. moment later another Transporter follows, racing out of t darkness after the first. BECK'S POV  We see the vital signs lit in a ring around h helmet.  The depth gauge races past with blinding speed a he moves closer to the surface. WILLIE'S POV  She tilts her head upwards.  She snaps off light and sees instead of black, a lighter gray, then suddenly faint traces of light in the water above her.  A first it seems like her eyes are playing tricks on her, t we see it again--a glimmer of light.
Light.  Beck, I see light!
He follows her look.  Light is coming fast, brightening a they rise.  The LED numbers inside their helmets click off..."125, 100, 75..."
Wait till you reach thirty- five before you blow your suit...
Roger.
WILLIE'S POV  Her numbers count down "....70, 60, 50, 40.
Ejecting.
She yanks at the handle on the chest plate and WHOOSH!  T plate bursts open and reveals a second interior handle. hand gropes for it.

head_text.subj: SUNLIGHT IS STREAMING DOWN THROUGH THE WATER AS SHE RUSHE

text: WHOOSH!  The helmet and torso of the suit are blown open she pulls the second lever detaching her from the balloon No longer oxygen supported or being pulled upward, Willie frees herself from the heavy suit and swims to the surfac

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY SHE BREAKS THE SURFACE AND CATCHES A GLIMPSE OF
SUN, DAZZLING THROUGH A MILLION DROPLETS OF WATER AS A HU
SWELL CARRIES HER UP EVEN HIGHER.

text: Then she's underwater again, struggling desperately to pu the tab on the life jacket around her neck.  Suddenly a M HAND GRABS THE TAB FOR HER AND PULLS.  She looks up at Be
We made it!
Where's Jones?

Holding onto each other Willie and Beck ride a swell.  At the crest WE SEE JONES in the trough below, face down.  B breaks away from Willie and swims through the waves to re Jones.  Reaching him Beck pulls his face out of the water and inflates his life jacket.
Is he okay?

Beck lays Jones head back against the life jacket.  For a moment.  Jones seems lifeless, then his eyes blink and sq against the sunlight.  Beck turns back to Willie and as h and Jones ride the next crest he gives her the "thumbs-up WILLIE(cont'd) (jubilant) The sun!  The sun!
Jones looks at Beck and grins.
What happened to that typhoon?
BECK, WILLIE AND JONES cling to each other as they search the horizon.
Are you sure you saw something?
How many times I got to tell you.  I saw a ship.
Well, why haven't they answered our flares?
We'll fire one more, that leaves us one last one.
BECK pulls the flare off his latex wet suit and fires it into the sky casting a comforting yellow glow over the da water.  The light fades, Willie looks at Jones.
Are you okay, Jonesy?
(weakly) Tip top, Willie...tip top.
(testing him) Who's the best power forward in the NBA...Jameson?
(tired, but with fight) Jameson?  Who are you trying to con...?
They both manage a weak laugh, then Beck sees something.
I'll be damned.  Look!...A flare!
As a small swell lifts them up we can see a tiny flare ju fading against the sky.
It saw us!
Answer them and quit kicking me!
I'm not touching you!
WHOOOOOOOOSH!  Beck fires another flare into the sky.  As flare arcs downward, Willie feels another bump and for th first time sees the SHARKS CIRCLING THEM.
No...no, no, no.
The SHARKS tighten the circle as the flare fades.
A CAPTAIN watches the flare fade through his binoculars a speaks to someone O.S.
I thought you said you'd combed this area?
He lowers his binoculars AS WE WIDEN TO REVEAL MARTIN standing on the bridge.  He also lowers his binoculars an smiles coolly as he lies.
We did....Many times.
(looks at Martin then to a Lieutenant) Initiate rescue.
We hold on Martin's face as from

head_text.subj: THE FORE DECK OF THE SHIP

text: A rescue chopper with pontoons lifts off the deck and ban off toward the fading flare.
Jones, Willie and Beck stay bunched close together. Suddenly Willie feels another bump.
(panicky) It hit me!  Where are they?!
